channel.title: Where did I go wrong? ~ Please only take a second!
channel.description:
I have both JRE and JDK downloaded and installed. I have both "ClassPath" and "Path" in the "User variables" and "System variables", the "ClassPath" says the following.
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin;
My "Path" says the following,
%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem;c:\Python22; C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin;
My JDK and JRE are both located in the C:\Program Files\Java\ and both the paths are right, so I'm not sure whats going on. I click on my "Rubik's Scape (508)" folder, which has been unzipped, then go to the folder called, "cmd", then click the "all.bat" file. It runs for a bit then says "press any key to continue...". So I do, then go and click on the "run.bat" and get "the system cannot get the path specified"... The contents of "run.bat" are the following.
@echo off cd ../bin "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe" palidino76/rs2/Server 43594 pause
Which seems right as the "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe" is where java.exe is located... Any help, I can't figure out what I've done wrong... :confused: *note: I haven't setup any sort of means to host this, I just wanted to run it "offline"*

item.title: Where did I go wrong? ~ Please only take a second!
item.dc:creator: @Enz0 Enz0
item.description:
@Enz0 wrote:

Nuke207:

accualy the most up to date is JDK1.6.0_10, which i have, not JDK1.6.0_7

Hmm, well I don’t think that would matter as the original batch files use the “jre1.6.0_07”

~ Enzo

Read full topic

item.title: Where did I go wrong? ~ Please only take a second!
item.dc:creator: @Enz0 Enz0
item.description:
@Enz0 wrote:

I have both JRE and JDK downloaded and installed.

I have both “ClassPath” and “Path” in the “User variables” and “System variables”, the “ClassPath” says the following.

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin;

My “Path” says the following,

%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem;c:\Python22; C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin;

My JDK and JRE are both located in the C:\Program Files\Java\ and both the paths are right, so I’m not sure whats going on.

I click on my “Rubik’s Scape (508)” folder, which has been unzipped, then go to the folder called, “cmd”, then click the “all.bat” file. It runs for a bit then says “press any key to continue…”. So I do, then go and click on the “run.bat” and get “the system cannot get the path specified”…

The contents of “run.bat” are the following.

@echo off cd ../bin "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe" palidino76/rs2/Server 43594 pause

Which seems right as the “C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe” is where java.exe is located…

Any help, I can’t figure out what I’ve done wrong…

note: I haven’t setup any sort of means to host this, I just wanted to run it “offline”
